<div align="center">
<h1>/logs</h1>
</div>

##### <div align="center">Contains log files generated by the application during runtime. These files record events, errors, and other diagnostic information, often configured using <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3670A0?style=for-the-badge&logo=python&logoColor=ffdd54" target="_blank" width="70" align='center'>'s logging module.</div>

<div style=display:inline-block>
<img align="center" height=50 src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c3/Python-logo-notext.svg/100px-Python-logo-notext.svg.png" />
: Stores output from Python's built-in `logging` module, capturing application events, debug information, and errors.
</div>
<div>
<img align="center" height=50 src="https://cdn-icons-png.flaticon.com/128/1008/1008331.png" />
: Typically contains files like `app.log`, `error.log`, or `access.log`, depending on the logging configuration and server setup. (Note: These files are usually excluded from version control via `.gitignore`).
</div>
